segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the type and function of the Product Exchange Message and to transmit its unique identifying number.
DTM, A segment identifying the date and time that the statment was generated and the end period to which the transaction statement refers.
MEA, This identifies the primary unit of account pertaining to the contract.
NAD, A segment identifying the two partners involved in the transaction identified in the following message. In this message the segment is mandatory and must appear twice; once for each partner.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A segment group to give the relevant exchange references (contract number with -if necessary- its dates) relating to the whole message.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the product exchange contract reference.
DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments giving transaction details of the product groups exchanged and opening and closing balances for the accounting period (or as a result of the transactions).

segment.documentation: IMD, A segment identifying the product group exchanged between the interchange partners.
QTY, A segment identifying the exchange balances for the contract during the period. It is used for opening balances and for closing balances.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments giving transaction details for each exchange transaction effected during the period.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the product exchanged between the interchange partners.
GIS, A segment identifying the transaction type (receipt, delivery etc) and (where required) duty status.
LOC, A segment identifying e.g. the oil terminal location involved in sending and receiving the product.
DTM, A segment identifying the date of supply.
MEA, A segment identifying measurement information for the product exchanged.
QTY, A segment identifying the quantity(ies) for the product exchanged.
TDT, A segment identifying the transport mode and appropriate movement identifier(s) for transaction.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying some unique number for each transaction.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the consignment note, ticket reference or some unique number for each transaction.
DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the reference.
